00040   const uint64_t DEFAULT_MAX_MEMORY = 20000000LL;

00042 
00043 void TableMutator::handle_exceptions() {
00044   try {
00045     throw;
00046   }
00047   catch (Exception &e) {
00048     m_last_error = e.code();
00049     HT_ERROR_OUT << e << HT_END;
00050 
00051     if (m_last_error == Error::TABLE_NOT_FOUND
00052         || m_last_error == Error::RANGESERVER_TABLE_NOT_FOUND)
00053       m_table->m_not_found = true;
00054   }
00055   catch (std::bad_alloc &e) {
00056     m_last_error = Error::BAD_MEMORY_ALLOCATION;
00057     HT_ERROR("caught bad_alloc here");
00058   }
00059   catch (std::exception &e) {
00060     m_last_error = Error::EXTERNAL;
00061     HT_ERRORF("caught std::exception: %s", e.what());
00062   }
00063   catch (...) {
00064     m_last_error = Error::EXTERNAL;
00065     HT_ERROR("caught unknown exception here");
00066   }
00067 }

00070 TableMutator::TableMutator(Comm *comm, Table *table, SchemaPtr &schema,
00071     RangeLocatorPtr &range_locator, uint32_t timeout_ms)
00072   : m_comm(comm), m_schema(schema), m_range_locator(range_locator),
00073     m_table(table), m_memory_used(0), m_max_memory(DEFAULT_MAX_MEMORY),
00074     m_resends(0), m_timeout_ms(timeout_ms), m_last_error(Error::OK),
00075     m_last_op(0) {
00076 
00077   HT_ASSERT(timeout_ms);
00078 
00079   m_buffer = new TableMutatorScatterBuffer(m_comm, &m_table->identifier(),
00080       m_schema, m_range_locator, timeout_ms);
00081 }

00084 void
00085 TableMutator::set(const KeySpec &key, const void *value, uint32_t value_len) {
00086   Timer timer(m_timeout_ms);
00087   HT_ASSERT(m_last_error == Error::OK);
00088 
00089   try {
00090     m_last_op = SET;
00091     key.sanity_check();
00092 
00093     Key full_key;
00094     to_full_key(key, full_key);
00095     m_buffer->set(full_key, value, value_len, timer);
00096     m_memory_used += 20 + key.row_len + key.column_qualifier_len + value_len;
00097     auto_flush(timer);
00098   }
00099   catch (...) {
00100     handle_exceptions();
00101     save_last(key, value, value_len);
00102     throw;
00103   }
00104 }

00107 void
00108 TableMutator::set_cells(Cells::const_iterator it, Cells::const_iterator end) {
00109   Timer timer(m_timeout_ms, "foo");
00110   HT_ASSERT(m_last_error == Error::OK);
00111 
00112   try {
00113     m_last_op = SET_CELLS;
00114 
00115     for (; it != end; ++it) {
00116       Key full_key;
00117       const Cell &cell = *it;
00118       cell.sanity_check();
00119 
00120       if (!cell.column_family) {
00121         full_key.row = cell.row_key;
00122         full_key.timestamp = cell.timestamp;
00123         full_key.revision = cell.revision;
00124         full_key.flag = cell.flag;
00125       }
00126       else
00127         to_full_key(cell, full_key);
00128 
00129       // assuming all inserts for now
00130       m_buffer->set(full_key, cell.value, cell.value_len, timer);
00131       m_memory_used += 20 + strlen(cell.row_key)
00132           + (cell.column_qualifier ? strlen(cell.column_qualifier) : 0);
00133     }
00134     auto_flush(timer);
00135   }
00136   catch (...) {
00137     handle_exceptions();
00138     save_last(it, end);
00139     throw;
00140   }
00141 }

00144 void TableMutator::set_delete(const KeySpec &key) {
00145   Timer timer(m_timeout_ms, "foo");
00146   Key full_key;
00147   HT_ASSERT(m_last_error == Error::OK);
00148 
00149   try {
00150     m_last_op = SET_DELETE;
00151     key.sanity_check();
00152 
00153     if (!key.column_family) {
00154       full_key.row = (const char *)key.row;
00155       full_key.timestamp = key.timestamp;
00156       full_key.revision = key.revision;
00157     }
00158     else
00159       to_full_key(key, full_key);
00160 
00161     m_buffer->set_delete(full_key, timer);
00162     m_memory_used += 20 + key.row_len + key.column_qualifier_len;
00163     auto_flush(timer);
00164   }
00165   catch (...) {
00166     handle_exceptions();
00167     m_last_key = key;
00168     throw;
00169   }
00170 }

00172 
00173 void
00174 TableMutator::to_full_key(const void *row, const char *column_family,
00175     const void *column_qualifier, int64_t timestamp, int64_t revision,
00176     uint8_t flag, Key &full_key) {
00177   if (!column_family)
00178     HT_THROW(Error::BAD_KEY, "Column family not specified");
00179 
00180   Schema::ColumnFamily *cf = m_schema->get_column_family(column_family);
00181 
00182   if (!cf)
00183     HT_THROWF(Error::BAD_KEY, "Bad column family '%s'", column_family);
00184 
00185   full_key.row = (const char *)row;
00186   full_key.column_qualifier = (const char *)column_qualifier;
00187   full_key.column_family_code = (uint8_t)cf->id;
00188   full_key.timestamp = timestamp;
00189   full_key.revision = revision;
00190   full_key.flag = flag;
00191 }

00194 void TableMutator::auto_flush(Timer &timer) {
00195   if (m_buffer->full() || m_memory_used > m_max_memory) {
00196     try {
00197       m_last_op = FLUSH;
00198       timer.start();
00199 
00200       if (m_prev_buffer)
00201         wait_for_previous_buffer(timer);
00202 
00203       m_buffer->send();
00204       m_prev_buffer = m_buffer;
00205       m_buffer = new TableMutatorScatterBuffer(m_comm,
00206           &m_table->identifier(), m_schema, m_range_locator, m_timeout_ms);
00207       m_memory_used = 0;
00208     }
00209     HT_RETHROW("auto flushing")
00210   }
00211 }
00212 
00213 
00214 void TableMutator::flush() {
00215   Timer timer(m_timeout_ms, true);
00216   HT_ASSERT(m_last_error == Error::OK);
00217 
00218   try {
00219     if (m_prev_buffer)
00220       wait_for_previous_buffer(timer);
00221 
00225     if (m_memory_used > 0) {
00226       m_buffer->send();
00227       m_prev_buffer = m_buffer;
00228       wait_for_previous_buffer(timer);
00229     }
00230 
00231     m_buffer->reset();
00232     m_prev_buffer = 0;
00233 
00234   }
00235   catch (...) {
00236     handle_exceptions();
00237     m_last_op = FLUSH;
00238     throw;
00239   }
00240 }

00242 
00243 bool TableMutator::retry(uint32_t timeout_ms) {
00244   uint32_t save_timeout = m_timeout_ms;
00245 
00246   if (m_last_error == Error::OK)
00247     return true;
00248 
00249   m_last_error = Error::OK;
00250 
00251   try {
00252     if (timeout_ms != 0)
00253       m_timeout_ms = timeout_ms;
00254 
00255     switch (m_last_op) {
00256     case SET:        set(m_last_key, m_last_value, m_last_value_len);   break;
00257     case SET_DELETE: set_delete(m_last_key);                            break;
00258     case SET_CELLS:  set_cells(m_last_cells_it, m_last_cells_end);      break;
00259     case FLUSH:      flush();                                           break;
00260     }
00261   }
00262   catch(...) {
00263     m_timeout_ms = save_timeout;
00264     return false;
00265   }
00266   m_timeout_ms = save_timeout;
00267   return true;
00268 }
00269 
00270 
00271 void TableMutator::wait_for_previous_buffer(Timer &timer) {
00272   try {
00273     TableMutatorScatterBuffer *redo_buffer = 0;
00274     uint32_t wait_time = 1000;
00275 
00276     while (!m_prev_buffer->wait_for_completion(timer)) {
00277 
00278       if (timer.remaining() < wait_time)
00279         HT_THROW_(Error::REQUEST_TIMEOUT);
00280 
00281       // wait a bit
00282       poll(0, 0, wait_time);
00283       wait_time += 2000;
00284 
00285       // redo buffer is needed to resend (ranges split/moves etc)
00286       if ((redo_buffer = m_prev_buffer->create_redo_buffer(timer)) == 0)
00287         continue;
00288 
00289       m_resends += m_prev_buffer->get_resend_count();
00290       m_prev_buffer = redo_buffer;
00291 
00292       // Re-send failed updates
00293       m_prev_buffer->send();
00294     }
00295   }
00296   HT_RETHROW("waiting for previous buffer")
00297 }

00299 
00300 std::ostream &
00301 TableMutator::show_failed(const Exception &e, std::ostream &out) {
00302   FailedMutations failed_mutations;
00303 
00304   get_failed(failed_mutations);
00305 
00306   if (!failed_mutations.empty()) {
00307     foreach(const FailedMutation &v, failed_mutations) {
00308       out << "Failed: (" << v.first.row_key << "," << v.first.column_family;
00309 
00310       if (v.first.column_qualifier && *(v.first.column_qualifier))
00311         out << ":" << v.first.column_qualifier;
00312 
00313       out << "," << v.first.timestamp << ") - "
00314           << Error::get_text(v.second) << '\n';
00315     }
00316     out.flush();
00317   }
00318   else throw e;
00319 
00320   return out;
00321 }
